qas.question: The word "genocide" was unknown until what year?
In 1941, how did Winston Churchill refer to the mass killings of Russian prisoners of war?
What was the name of the Polish-Jewish lawyer who first described Nazi atrocities as "genocide?"
What is the etymological basis of the word "genocide?"

answers.text: Greek prefix geno- (meaning tribe or race) and caedere (the Latin word for to kill)

qas.question: As it pertains to violent crimes against targeted groups, what is the ultimate motivation within the actions of genocide?

answers.text: to remove the entire group from existence or to destroy them

qas.question: When was the word "genocide" last used?
Who referred to acts of genocide in 1945?
What year was the word "genocide" known until?
What is defined as a specific set of violent crimes that are committed against a certain group with the attempt to remove the entire group from existence or to increase them?
When was the phrase "prisoners of war" first used?

plausible_answers.text: a specific set of violent crimes that are committed against a certain group with the attempt to remove the entire group from existence or to destroy them

qas.question: What is the definition of "prisoners of war"?
Who coined the phrase "prisoners of war"?
The phrase "prisoners of war" was unknown until what year?
In 1941, how did Raphael Lemkin refer to the mass killings of Russian prisoners of war?

context: <b10_0>Genocide<b10_0/> has become an official term used in international relations. The word genocide was not in use before <a0_0><b5_0><b8_0><b13_0>1944<b13_0/><b8_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>. Before this, in 1941, <b7_0>Winston Churchill<b7_0/> described the mass killing of Russian prisoners of war and civilians <a1_0><b14_0>as "a crime without a name"<a1_0/>.<b14_0/> In that year, a Polish-Jewish lawyer named <a2_0><b6_0><b12_0>Raphael Lemkin<b12_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, described the policies of systematic murder founded by the Nazis as <b9_0>genocide<b9_0/>. The word genocide is the combination of the <a3_0>Greek prefix geno- (meaning tribe or race) and caedere (the Latin word for to kill)<a3_0/>. The word is defined as <b11_0>a specific set of violent crimes that are committed against a certain group with the attempt <a4_0>to remove the entire group from existence or to destroy them<b11_0/><a4_0/>.
